title.rendered: Indie Gaming Platform Itch.io Calls NFTs a SCAM

content.rendered:
Editorial: Gaming / Facebook / Twitter / Coverage / Instagram / Discord

The independent video game digital platform Itch.io spoke out against NFTs and their uses in video games, calling them a scam in a statement via Twitter after being constantly asked about this technology and its application in the industry.

Itch.io has also positioned itself against companies that have come out in favor of NFTs while claiming to support creators: “Also fuck any company that says it supports creators and also supports NFTs from some way. They only care about their own benefit and opportunity for wealth above anyone else.”

“If you really think that they are useful for something other than the exploitation of creators, financial scams and the destruction of the planet, we ask you to please re-evaluate the decisions you have made in your life”, sentenced the company.

Itch.io statement regarding NFTs.

This stance is in stark contrast to the position of Ubisoft, which announced that it would start selling NFTs in games like Ghost Recon: Breakpoint as part of a scheme called Ubisoft Quartz and which was also criticized by its own employees.

Itch.io is a digital distribution platform, aimed at publishing independent video games, which allows you to organize game jams, publish sprites, music, software, comics, books, and any type of digital content. Created by Leaf Corcoran in 2013, it currently has more than 400,000 games.
